Key Match Events: De'Aaron Fox led the way with 33 points, 6 rebounds, and 6 assists.
Domantas Sabonis quietly put together a strong performance with 17 points and 16 rebounds.
Sacramento held Dallas to just 40 points in the second half and used their defense to lead to offense, finishing the game with 25 points off 17 Mavericks turnovers.
Post-Match Reflections: On a night where the Kings desperately needed a win, the Kings two stars led on the court and brought intensity all night.
Sacramento has a long way to go to climb back into the Western Conference playoff picture, but tonight was a step in the right direction.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sacramento Kings season was on the brink, facing an injury-riddled Dallas Mavericks who were missing Luka Dončić, Kyrie Irving, and Klay Thompson.
The Kings fell behind 37-23 to end the first quarter but battled back and used a big third quarter to create separation from the Mavs, ultimately winning 110-100.
